metadata.title: CVE-2024-26673 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nft_ct: sanitize layer 3 and 4 protocol number in customexpectations - Disallow families other than NFPROTO_{IPV4,IPV6,INET}. -Disallow layer 4 protocol with no ports, since destination port is amandatory attribute for this object.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26673` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-181-generic - 5.4.0-181.201~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-181-lowlatency - 5.4.0-181.201~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-181.201~18.04.1').
